page.title: 02HEMEL HEMPSTEAD INTRODUCTION
page.content: The factory estate to the N.E. has changed and some larger places have closed to be replaced by diverse small units, although the trend is still to skilled engineering and high technology. Employment figures are good for these times but many people travel out of Hemel to work. The moor near the town centre is park like with grass and flowerbeds. Further out the canal and moor seem almost rural. Nowhere is far from the countryside and a striking feature is that buildings stop suddenly right next to open land.This is closely farmed to the N. and E. but to the S. it is mostly well wooded and attractive. The town seems to have more than its fair share of vandalism and litter but is well liked by those who can remember the old housing conditions.
